intro: Otomeria speciosa, commonly known as the showy otomeria, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red, often with a yellow throat. Otomeria speciosa typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage is palmately lobed, adding to its ornamental appeal in gardens and natural habitats.
